text: The recently opened Panama Station, in the City of Brossard, is poised to be a catalyst for development in Greater Montreal.

It is at the centre of a master-planned transit-oriented development (TOD), unique in Canada, which calls for mid-rise density, abundant green space, and a focus on liveability in an area that is likely to experience strong market demand for residential growth in the coming decades.
But experience in other North American TODs shows that it is very difficult to densify suburban areas without significant attention to implementation.
